title: Sales Communication Simulation Workshop: Training in Mathematics-Based Persuasion Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Fundamental Mathematical Concepts and Digital Device Utilization Skills
context.additional_context: Composed of real-life application scenarios linked to math curricula, with mobile app-based role-playing in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Learners can construct customer-tailored persuasive messages using mathematical data with over 80% accuracy.
Improve communication strategies through repeated feedback (three or more times) in role-play simulations.

In teams, learners perform data analysis (e.g., sales trends, customer preferences) reflecting real sales scenarios (e.g., school cafeteria improvements), create presentation materials with three persuasive strategies (discount proposals, service enhancements, customer benefit highlights), and meet peer evaluation standards (5-point scale, â‰¥3.5 points).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
